jsx.ui
Class Widget.Event<T>

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.Configurable
          jsx.Source.Event<T>
              jsx.ui.Widget.Event<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Animation, Change, Check, Click, Close, DblClick, DragOut, DragOver, MouseDown, MouseOut, MouseOver, MouseUp, Popup, Position, Progress, Render, Resize, Style, Uncheck
Enclosing class:
Widget
public abstract static class Widget.Event<T>
extends Source.Event<T>

An abstract base class for high level events to be fired from widgets.

This class is designed generic with the type parameter being the type of its corresponding listener type. A subclass must be concrete and final if it is to be an event type. As an event type, the subclass must also declare the type parameter of this class as the type of its own listener.

An event listener is typically of an interface with a declared method to react on the event it handles so that the class of the event can implement the Source.Event.execute(Object) method by simply calling that declared method passing the event itself as the argument. A subclass of this class defines events uniquely typed by the subclass itself and designates a listener type corresponding to that type of events.

For an event source to fire an event, the listener of the event must have been registered onto the source object with a call to the Source.addListener(Class, Object) method which asks both the type of the event and the listener object for arguments.

Note that, high level events are Configurable.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

Field Detail

BROWSEREVENT

protected static final Id<JsEvent> BROWSEREVENT

A global identifier for a configurable property of an Widget.Event object.

The identified configurable property of an Widget.Event object is a reference to the browser event held by the high level event.

Since:
1.0

TARGET

protected static final Id<Component> TARGET

A global identifier for a configurable property of an Widget.Event object.

The identified configurable property of an Widget.Event object is a reference to the target component held by the event.

Since:
1.0
Constructor Detail

Widget.Event

protected Widget.Event(ObjectLike ini)

A typical constructor forcing constructors of subclasses to pass initializing data.

This constructor simply invokes the typical constructor of the superclass passing the specified initializing object as the argument.

Note that, this constructor does not change the configurable properties Source.Event.BUBBLE and Source.Event.UPDATE of this event object.

Since:
1.0

Widget.Event

protected Widget.Event(Component target)

A typical constructor passing the target component.

This constructor creates an initializing object, sets its configurable property TARGET to the argument component and then invokes the default constructor of this class passing the newly created initializing object as the argument.

Note that, this constructor does not change the configurable properties Source.Event.BUBBLE and Source.Event.UPDATE of this event object.

Since:
1.0

Widget.Event

protected Widget.Event()

The default constructor which simply invokes the default constructor of the superclass.

Note that, this constructor does not change the configurable properties Source.Event.BUBBLE and Source.Event.UPDATE of this event object.

Since:
1.0

getTarget

public static final Component getTarget(Widget.Event<?> evt)

Gets the component referenced by the configurable property TARGET of a specified event.

Parameters:

Returns:
